Class Table

java.lang.Object
pt.up.fe.els2024.Table
public class Table extends Object
Table represents a table structure with columns and rows. A table has a name and a list of columns, where each column can contain multiple rows.

This class provides methods to manipulate columns, including adding, removing, renaming columns, and retrieving columns by name. It also supports adding rows to columns and extracting subtables.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    Table()
    Default constructor initializes a table with no name and an empty list of columns.

    Table(String name, List<Column> columns)
    Constructor to initialize a table with a specific name and a given list of columns.

  • Constructor Details

    • Table

      public Table()
      Default constructor initializes a table with no name and an empty list of columns.

    • Table

      public Table(String name)
      Constructor to initialize a table with a specific name. The columns list will be empty upon creation.
      Parameters:
      name - the name of the table

    • Table

      public Table(String name, List<Column> columns)
      Constructor to initialize a table with a specific name and a given list of columns.
      Parameters:
      name - the name of the table
      columns - the list of columns to initialize the table with

  • Method Details

    • getName

      public String getName()
      Retrieves the name of the table.
      Returns:
      the name of the table

    • setName

      public void setName(String name)
      Sets a new name for the table.
      Parameters:
      name - the new name to assign to the table

    • addColumn

      public void addColumn(Column column)
      Adds a new column to the table.
      Parameters:
      column - the column to add

    • addColumn

      public void addColumn(Column column, boolean insertAtStart)
      Adds a new column to the table, optionally inserting it at the start.
      Parameters:
      column - the column to add
      insertAtStart - if true, inserts the column at the start of the columns list, otherwise adds it at the end

    • setColumns

      public void setColumns(List<Column> columns)
      Sets the columns of the table with a given list of columns.
      Parameters:
      columns - the list of columns to set

    • appendColumns

      public void appendColumns(List<Column> columns)
      Appends additional columns to the table.
      Parameters:
      columns - the list of columns to append

    • getColumn

      public Column getColumn(String name)
      Retrieves a column by its name.
      Parameters:
      name - the name of the column
      Returns:
      the column with the specified name, or null if no such column exists

    • getColumns

      public List<Column> getColumns()
      Retrieves the list of columns in the table.
      Returns:
      a list of columns in the table

    • appendToColumn

      public boolean appendToColumn(String columnName, Object value)
      Appends a new value to a specified column.
      Parameters:
      columnName - the name of the column to append the value to
      value - the value to append to the column
      Returns:
      true if the value was successfully appended, false otherwise

    • checkColumn

      public Column checkColumn(String columnName) throws OperationException
      Checks if a column exists by its name.
      Parameters:
      columnName - the name of the column to check
      Returns:
      the column if it exists
      Throws:
      OperationException - if the column does not exist

    • renameColumn

      public void renameColumn(String columnOldName, String columnNewName) throws OperationException
      Renames an existing column.
      Parameters:
      columnOldName - the old name of the column
      columnNewName - the new name of the column
      Throws:
      OperationException - if the old column name doesn't exist

    • remove

      public void remove(String columnName) throws OperationException
      Removes a column by its name.
      Parameters:
      columnName - the name of the column to remove
      Throws:
      OperationException - if the column doesn't exist

    • getSubTables

      public List<Table> getSubTables(List<String> directory)
      Retrieves a list of subtables by traversing through nested columns and matching the directory path. The directory path is a list of column names to navigate through the nested structure.
      Parameters:
      directory - the directory path to match
      Returns:
      a list of subtables matching the directory path
